title: Interpret the $P$-value for a Linear Regression Test
question_text:
Are middle school students who like their science class more likely to enjoy their math class as well? Below is the linear regression output for a randomly chosen group of $50$ middle school students. These $50$ students were asked to rank both their science and their math class on a scale of $0$ to $5$ (the higher the rating, the more the student enjoys the class).
Predictor Coef SE Coef $T$ $P$
Constant $1.187$ $0.56$ $2.44$ $0.042$
Science $0.5254$ $0.1995$ $2.63$ $0.014$
Which of the following is the correct value and the correct interpretation of the $P$-value of the test for the hypotheses Ho: $\beta = 0$ vs Ha: $\beta > 0$?

choices.text: $0.042$; There is a $4.2$% chance of obtaining results like these or results more extreme, under the assumption that there is not a linear relationship between the rating of a science class and the rating of a math class.
$0.042$; There is a $4.2$% chance of obtaining results like these, under the assumption that there is not a linear relationship between the rating of a science class and the rating of a math class.

$0.014$; There is a $1.4$% chance of obtaining results like these or results more extreme, under the assumption that there is a linear relationship between the rating of a science class and the rating of a math class.
